neighbors.name: Charles Benjamin Payne
neighbors.claims: Charles B. Payne is listed as a longtime resident on Hummingbird Lane in Falling Waters, Berkeley County [Telephone Directory](https://www.telephonedirectories.us/WhitePages/Falling_Waters-WV). He does not serve on the county’s farm protection or conservation boards and has no recorded public involvement in local development issues [Berkeley County Farmland Board](https://wvfp.org/berkeley/board-officers/) ([www.wvca.us](https://www.wvca.us/directory/cds.cfm#:~:text=Nancy%20Lutz%20,Secretary%2025%20Koontztown%20Road)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private landowner; no public roles

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected local farmer approach him, emphasizing how the project can co-exist with farming and maintain the rural peace he values.

neighbors.name: Kenneth G. Byers & Ruth M. Byers
neighbors.claims: Kenneth G. Byers and his wife Ruth M. Byers jointly own a parcel in the Falling Waters area of Berkeley County (Potomac District) ([taxinq.berkeleywv.org](https://taxinq.berkeleywv.org/ticket.html?TPSX=&TPTICK=14990&TPTYR=2022#:~:text=District%3A%20%20%7C%2002%20,WATERS%20WV%2025419%20Lending%20Inst)). They are not noted in any public committee or board memberships locally, and no public statements from them on development or energy projects could be found in local records [Berkeley County Farmland Board](https://wvfp.org/berkeley/board-officers/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Retired rural residents; low public profile

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach through a neighbor or farm community contact who can discuss how the project will protect farmland value and respect their property rights.

neighbors.name: Daniel Whitacre Folk IV
neighbors.claims: Daniel W. Folk IV is part of a longstanding local family; he served as executor for the Estate of June Whitacre Folk, indicating a multi-generation presence in Berkeley County [The Journal](https://wvlegals.com/public-notice-7434/) ([wvlegals.com](https://wvlegals.com/public-notice-7434/#:~:text=ESTATE%20NAME%3A%20JUNE%20WHITACRE%20FOLK,FOLK%20FIDUCIARY)). Aside from settling a family estate, there is no record of Folk holding public office or speaking in county meetings about development issues [Berkeley County Farmland Board](https://wvfp.org/berkeley/board-officers/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime family landowner; no official role

approach_recommendations.engage: Highlight the project’s provisions for land restoration and long-term stewardship to appeal to his sense of family land legacy and preserving his farm for future generations.

neighbors.name: David W. Henry
neighbors.claims: David W. Henry owns multiple parcels in the Potomac District of Berkeley County ([taxinq.berkeleywv.org](https://taxinq.berkeleywv.org/ticket.html?TPSX=&TPTICK=14990&TPTYR=2022#:~:text=District%3A%20%20%7C%2002%20,WATERS%20WV%2025419%20Lending%20Inst)). He has no known public profile in county affairs – he is not listed among any local boards or civic groups, and no statements from him on development have been documented in the media [Berkeley County Farmland Board](https://wvfp.org/berkeley/board-officers/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Landholder; no public involvement

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Mr. Henry via a community meeting with other landowners, stressing that local input will guide the project and that farmland conservation measures will be upheld.

neighbors.name: Max O. Oates Jr.; Theodore K. Oates II; Mary Elizabeth Oates
neighbors.claims: Max O. Oates Jr. is part of a prominent Berkeley County family; his late father, Dr. Max Oates, and mother Evelyn were longtime Martinsburg residents who played a vital leadership role in the local hospital and health services ([www.wvlegislature.gov](https://www.wvlegislature.gov/bill_status/bills_text.cfm?billdoc=scr39+intr.htm&billtype=cr&houseorig=s&i=39&sesstype=RS&yr=2012#:~:text=Whereas%2C%20Dr,of%20Martinsburg%2C%20West%20Virginia%3B%20and)). The Oates family has been extensively involved in community betterment, although none of the current members have publicly taken a stance on energy or development projects ([www.wvlegislature.gov](https://www.wvlegislature.gov/bill_status/bills_text.cfm?billdoc=scr39+intr.htm&billtype=cr&houseorig=s&i=39&sesstype=RS&yr=2012#:~:text=Whereas%2C%20Dr,selfless%20service%20can%20engender%3B%20and)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Respected family; civic and philanthropic ties

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a well-respected local official or community leader approach the Oates family, acknowledging their community service and explaining how the project will be locally managed and bring economic benefits to fund community services.

neighbors.name: Todd A. Gladfelter and Karen Gladfelter
neighbors.claims: Todd A. Gladfelter and Karen Gladfelter are listed as owners of a property at 473 Michelle Drive in the Potomac District of Berkeley County (PIN 02-9G0018-0000-0000) ([Redfin](https://www.redfin.com/WV/Hedgesville/473-Michelle-Dr-25427/home/15850558)). Karen Gladfelter (age 66) is recorded as a resident of Hedgesville, WV ([NationalPublicData](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/g/karen-gladfelter/)). The property is situated in a rural subdivision of ~1-acre residential lots ([Redfin](https://www.redfin.com/WV/Hedgesville/473-Michelle-Dr-25427/home/15850558)). No references to either Todd or Karen Gladfelter engaging in local government meetings or public commentary on development were found in available Berkeley County Planning Commission records ([Berkeley County](https://berkeleywv.org/AgendaCenter/ViewFile/Minutes/_12022024-1101)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private residents; no public offices found

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach the Gladfelters in a neighborly, face-to-face manner. Emphasize maintaining the quiet rural character of the area and reassure them that their property values and privacy will be respected.

neighbors.name: Jamie G. Roseman and Dianna L. Roseman
neighbors.claims: Jamie G. Roseman and Dianna L. Roseman reside on Michelle Drive in Hedgesville, WV ([Dignity Memorial](https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/martinsburg-wv/clay-elliott-10886643)). Jamie Roseman has been active in the local community, volunteering with the Berkeley County Youth Fair and the Hedgesville Little League Baseball Field ([Dignity Memorial](https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/martinsburg-wv/clay-elliott-10886643)). He is also a long-time member of a hunting club in nearby Romney, WV ([Dignity Memorial](https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/martinsburg-wv/clay-elliott-10886643)). No record of the Rosemans participating in recent Berkeley County Planning Commission hearings on development issues was found ([Berkeley County](https://www.berkeleywv.org/AgendaCenter/PreviousVersions/_03042024-839)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Active volunteer in youth sports and county fair

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Mr. Roseman with a friendly visit, acknowledging his community service with the Youth Fair and Little League. Discuss how the project aligns with local interests and wildlife preservation, given his outdoor background.

neighbors.name: Scott Michael Shimel
neighbors.claims: Scott Michael Shimel is the owner of a property at 506 Michelle Drive in Hedgesville, WV (PIN 02-9G0020-0000-0000) ([Redfin](https://www.redfin.com/WV/Hedgesville/506-Michelle-Dr-25427/home/15850556)). Public records indicate he is 42 years old ([NationalPublicData](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/s/scott-shimel/)). In August 2022, a Scott Shimel was named General Manager for BlackHawk Industrial in Southern California, having spent over 20 years in the industrial distribution industry in that region ([Industrial Supply Magazine](https://industrialsupplymagazine.com/pages/News-080822-BlackHawk-Industrial-hires-industry-veteran-Shimel.php)). It is unclear if he resides full-time in Berkeley County. No public statements on local development projects were found in Berkeley County records ([Berkeley County](https://www.berkeleywv.org/AgendaCenter/ViewFile/Minutes/_03172025-1199)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Industry professional; unclear local residency status

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out to Mr. Shimel to introduce the project. Given his industrial business background, he may appreciate a straightforward, data-driven discussion about the project's economic and operational details.

neighbors.name: Tyler James Cloud and Jacob Ashby Cloud
neighbors.claims: Tyler James Cloud and Jacob Ashby Cloud are identified as the grandchildren of the late Janice Thomas Cloud, a long-time resident of Hedgesville, WV ([Brown Funeral Homes](https://www.brownfuneralhomeswv.com/memorials/Cloud-Janice/1357736/help)). The draft profile associated them with PIN 02-9000-1000-4000; however, county records indicate this PIN corresponds to a property in Jefferson County (Charles Town), not Berkeley County ([Charles Town Annexation Application](https://cms2.revize.com/revize/charlestownwv/Documents/Government/Plans%20and%20Proposals/Application_Submitted_to_County_Commission.pdf)). Consequently, their specific land ownership in Berkeley County could not be verified in this audit. There is no indication that Tyler or Jacob Cloud have publicly expressed views on land development in Berkeley County ([Berkeley County](https://www.berkeleywv.org/554/Planning)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local family ties; no public profile found

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact the Cloud brothers via a friendly introduction to clarify their property interest in the project area. Highlight opportunities for young residents and respect for their family's long-standing ties to the Hedgesville community.

neighbors.name: Robert M Cloud & Brenda L Cloud
neighbors.claims: Robert M. Cloud serves as an elected Supervisor for the Eastern Panhandle Conservation District (EPCD), representing Berkeley County ([WVCA Directory](https://www.wvca.us/suDirectory.cfm)). In this capacity, he participates in board meetings regarding agricultural enhancement programs, watershed grants, and conservation planning ([EPCD Minutes](https://www.wvca.us/district/upload/41246.pdf)). The Cloud family is a recipient of agricultural subsidies ([EWG Database](https://farm.ewg.org/addrsearch.php?z=1&zip=25427&page=1)). The EPCD has previously discussed the environmental impact of solar projects on farmland and soil erosion ([Vision Root](https://www.visionroot.org/category/environment/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Elected Supervisor, Eastern Panhandle Conservation District

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage directly acknowledging his role as an EPCD Supervisor. Focus heavily on stormwater management, soil conservation, and pollinator-friendly ground cover, demonstrating how the project aligns with district conservation goals.

neighbors.name: Mark Chenoweth & Scarlett Chenoweth
neighbors.claims: Mark Chenoweth is the President and General Counsel of the New Civil Liberties Alliance (NCLA), a legal organization focused on challenging the administrative state ([NCLA Bio](https://www.legistorm.com/person/bio/158982/Markham_Sterling_Chenoweth.html)). He previously served as the first Chief of Staff to Congressman Mike Pompeo and as legal counsel at the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission ([LegiStorm](https://www.legistorm.com/person/bio/158982/Markham_Sterling_Chenoweth.html)). He has testified before the U.S. House Judiciary Committee regarding regulatory reform ([Congress Testimony](https://www.congress.gov/118/meeting/house/116992/witnesses/HHRG-118-JU05-Wstate-ChenowethM-20240320.pdf)). He was named one of Washington DC's 500 Most Influential People of 2025 ([Washingtonian](https://washingtonian.com/2025/05/07/washington-dcs-500-most-influential-people-of-2025/)). Scarlett Chenoweth is listed as a resident of Hedgesville ([Whitepages](https://www.whitepages.com/name/Scarlett-Chenoweth/WV)).
neighbors.influence_justification: President of NCLA; former Congressional Chief of Staff

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with high-level professionalism. Be prepared to discuss regulatory compliance and property rights in detail. Emphasize that the project respects private property rights and avoids government overreach.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Smiths through one-on-one conversation to build trust. As a local healthcare provider, Mr. Smith may have a network of local patients; a professional, transparent approach is recommended.

citations.title: Wellness.com Chiropractor Listing Falling Waters WV

citations.claim: No public statements on development were found
citations.title: Berkeley County Assessor

neighbors.name: FFPLS Hedgesville LLC
neighbors.claims: FFPLS Hedgesville LLC is the owner of approximately 58 acres along WV Route 9 (Hedgesville Rd) where a multi-lot commercial development known as “Maple Ridge Station” has been proposed ([source](https://wvlegals.com/public-notice-28467/)). The development plan includes a proposed 33,100 sq. ft. multi-bay vehicle and truck maintenance facility on Lot 1 ([source](https://wvlegals.com/public-notice-28467/)). The LLC has marketed portions of the tract for sale, including a 27.3-acre lot listed at approximately $2.32 million and a 4-acre lot for $400,000 ([source](https://www.crexi.com/properties/WV/Martinsburg)), indicating an intent to develop or sell the land for profit. Listings note that the seller will provide site work for an additional cost ([source](https://www.loopnet.com/Listing/1810-Hedgesville-Road-Martinsburg-WV/35028923/)). The entity is listed as a defendant in multiple civil actions in Berkeley County, including Case Nos. 2022-C-000073 and 2022-C-000074 ([source](https://apps.sos.wv.gov/business/service-of-process/Home/Search?DefendantName=FFPLS%20HEDGESVILLE%20LLC)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Privately-held land developer with a single identified commercial project; no record of broad community leadership or political office found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the LLC’s managing agent or developer directly; emphasize how the project can coexist or even enhance their site’s value (e.g. infrastructure upgrades). If needed, offer coordination on access or buffers to address any concerns about property value or visibility.

overview_summary: Screening of 15 neighbors—comprising 14 residents and one land development organization—reveals that all currently hold an unknown stance toward the project. While 10 neighbors have low influence, three individuals possess high influence, including a bank executive and the Oates family, who are noted for their civic leadership. The identified organization is a profit-driven LLC focused on commercial conversion, while the residential majority consists of private landowners in the Potomac District whose concerns likely center on rural preservation. No formal opposition has been documented among the five high- and medium-influence neighbors, but their prominent roles suggest they are key stakeholders for initial outreach.
